results.description:
I am a college student that uses mastering chemistry by pearson higher ed for home work. Pretty much everything works great. My assignments seem to contain little flash modules where you put different shapes into respective bins. Simple stuff. My problem is, when I finish a home work assignment I like to print them off for reference later. In the print screen from pearsoned.com, Firefox will show the flash stuff, but will not print the flash stuff that is rendered on the screen. Saving to PDF doesn't help as the final product also omits the flash based stuff too. Firefox will looks like it is going to print properly, but fails to do so.
***However, Safari will print everything from the preceding scenarios flawlessly.*** Not sure what this is all about, but it's frustrating for a few of the people I know.

Today everything worked fine until I performed an update to firefox for mac. Now it blocks virtually everything. Most bothersome is https://www.google.com

error is:
"You have asked Firefox to connect securely to www.google.com, but we can't confirm that your connection is secure.

Normally, when you try to connect securely, sites will present trusted identification to prove that you are going to the right place. However, this site's identity can't be verified.
What Should I Do?

If you usually connect to this site without problems, this error could mean that someone is trying to impersonate the site, and you shouldn't continue.

This site uses HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS) to specify that Firefox only connect to it securely. As a result, it is not possible to add an exception for this certificate.

www.google.com uses an invalid security certificate.

The certificate is not trusted because the issuer certificate is unknown.
The server might not be sending the appropriate intermediate certificates.
An additional root certificate may need to be imported.

(Error code: sec_error_unknown_issuer)"

results.description:
Firefox is becoming increasingly buggy and unstable under OS 6.8 Snow Leopard. This last update, I would like to undo, if I could. Now I can't load CaringBridge, which loads just fine in Safari. Also, pages/tabs are taking way too long to load when restoring from a crash, and while they load (pause, pause pause), Firefox is inoperable. You can't even switch tabs. I usually switch to Safari and read another page while waiting for FF to reload multiple tabs.
Don't know if it's a FF or Facebook problem, but after a few cut & pastes, the paste process quits working. It's been this way for several months. Drives me crazy. I'm used to dragging URLS and  text clippings to FB. FF clipboard usually quits working, no copy/no paste after a few triesâ€”it requires a complete restart to fix. 
Sometimes I can trick FB into accepting an URL by dragging it from Safari. So, I'd venture to say it's a FF problem, not a FB one. 
Also, runaway memory leakage is horrid. No way 6 tabs needs 2-3 GB of memory to run. I need to crash FF several times a day with Activity Monitor  when it hogs all my memory (&/or
 crash the FF plugins when it stallsâ€”buggy scripts). I've tried running FF sans ad-ons, and it still goes berzerk. Suggest that you look into FF incompatabilities with legacy Mac OS architecture (starting about 6 months ago). 
MBPro 3,1. 6GB memory OS 6.8 Snow Leopard. 
But the hanging window / tab that won't finish loading has got to go. Or I'm done with FF. Was a time when FF was my go-to web browser. But it's so bad and buggy now, I barely use it for anything except FB. Not worth babysitting it.

results.description:
Hi, 

I've already raised that flag in French a while ago, and since then, my beta copy of Firefox for Mac (32-bit) has been upgraded several times, but the problem remains, and can also be noted on Windows: 

When Firefox isn't running and you trigger its opening by clicking on a link in your default email client (Thunderbird in my case, but it also happens in Mail.app), then the home page is overwritten by the page the link sends you to, instead of said link opening in a new foreground tab, the way it does in non-beta versions of Firefox. 

I have set Firefox to open the last visited tabs/pages on startup, and when I close Firefox, I usually leave only one page open: my homepage. 

Therefore, when I click on a link in an email, this should cause Firefox to open the page the link points to in a new foreground tab, next to my homepage, instead of overwriting the latter. 

I've checked Tab Mix Plus (up-to-date) preferences, and nothing's changed when compared to regular versions of Firefox (i.e., non-beta), so there's nothing there, IMO. 

Can you please fix this? I know it sounds minor, if not trivial, but it denotes a regression that may not have been brought to your attention. 

Feel free to contact me if you need more info, or want to test something. 

Kind regards, 

Didier

results.description:
I recently sent feedback about not being able to set a custom newtab page anymore. I know the decision was made because software/extensions were hijacking the newtab page, and changing it. I'm informing you that one of my clients STILL had their newtab page hijacked, and set to be an ask.com search page but the DOC2PDF extension. The client was using Firefox 41.0.1â€”the latest version that includes the newtab policy change.

My client knew their newtab page was hijacked because they DIDN'T see the custom page that I set for them. PLEASE consider changing the newtab customization policy. Please allow users to customize their newtab page again. Obviously, the new policy still isn't protecting users since the DOC2PDF extension was still able to change it. Please consider making exposing this setting as part of the Preferences UI, and adding a warning when then setting is changed. The custom newtab page is an important security customization I make to my clients' installation of Firefox.

I'm including the URL to the page I set as a custom newtab just so you can see what I need my real estate agents to see every time they create a new tab. It's important that they see my landing page whenever they create a new tab.

results.description:
I recently added the ability to send articles (newspapers) via Gmail (I guess this is referred to as a service) and when I sent the article it showed up as someones else's Gmail address (as the sender). Why is this????????
I have looked for a way to change this, but can't find what even is causing it. Now here is the strange part. The other person's email address turns out to be my own daughter. So, as I was clicking on various things to try and find a way to change this I found I am able to access her private email (NOT great!!!) on this account in Gmail. Just as though I was the one that set it up. What gives????
She does not use my computer and I do not use hers. My Gmail address is totally different from hers, but when I added this service to use Gmail to send something while in Firefox I saw the senders Email address as being NOT MINE. That only happened because when I sent the article, I sent one to me.
Please reply so we can get this corrected. Not a good security issue. Thank you. Brad
